title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jackson State University
Interview Descriptions: HR recruiter scheduled the best time to meet with the hiring manger virtually. Once a time was established and they provided the standard screening and email follow up. Was a bit nervous as I am not a good interviewer. Especially virtually. that made me extremely nervous just to think about it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the job

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Jackson State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was typical for academia. Several members of faculty met and interviewed candidates. Everyone was very kind and it was a pretty laidback atmosphere during my experience. I am sure this varies, depending on the committee members present.
Interview Questions: How I handled a difficult situation.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jackson State University (Jackson, MS) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straight forward. A few tough questions about dedication and time management. Took place virtually due to the pandemic. There were 3 people on the call. They got back to me quickly with a decision after the interview.
Interview Questions: How will you manage your time?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jackson State University
Interview Descriptions: 3 parts consisting on initial review group interview and personal interview. Application process is quite straight forward with easy to answer question must have 2 refrences you will receive email notification about job acceptance. Pay package changed yearly
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress

title: Part Time Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jackson State University (Jackson, MS) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was ok I can't think of anything to add other than the process of was ok I can add anything other than the process was ok I can't anything other than the process of was ok
Interview Questions: publish any, interview question about the pandemic

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Jackson State University (Jackson, MS)
Interview Descriptions: I was first given a phone interview with the assistant. Once I successfully passed the phone  interview, I was granted an in person interview. I was asked a few questions, and the introduced to the team. After that they offered me the position on the spot. I started 3 months later.
Interview Questions: Mainly questions to gauge experience, and ability to multi task.

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jackson State University (Jackson, MS) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I apply online, then after 2 weeks I get a call from HR then after that an interview. the process was fast, but the background  check and the drug test take time.
Interview Questions: your degree, and the experience

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jackson State University
Interview Descriptions: There were about 40 people in the hiring process for this particular job, but half of us were chosen. The interview ranged any where from 15 minutes to 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jackson State University (Jackson, MS) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview is not hard. They asked me several questions, and it took about one hour. There are about 10 people applied for this job, and I got two good letters from my professors for this job. I think those help.
Interview Questions: What are your skills for this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jackson State University
Interview Descriptions: Asked what my fields of interest were and how I would make the required research topic pertain to my interests and did I have enough time to devote to this internship. If your GPA is up to par, the interview is a breeze as you have proven your capability. If it is not as high as you would like, work much harder in proving that you are the person for the position.
Interview Questions: Asked what my fields of interest were and how I would make the required research topic pertain to my interests. The interview process was fairly simple and straightforward.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jackson State University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was informative and included a tour and lunch. I also met other people in the department. Parking was horrible but the campus was very appealing. The students were interesting.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jackson State University in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact was made by me as I heard of the Research Center. From there all I had to do was show up for some workshops to familiarize myself with the program and keep a high gpa.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was why should we choose you over all other students who wants to be a part of this lab
